instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: Need backlight driver but which one
threads.message:
Hi folks,

I need some backlight drivers but rossmanngroup is sold out (I typically order from there).
So I look for <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> on mouser and find 3 results, all of which appear identical in their datasheets.
[url]https://www.mouser.com/Search/Refine.aspx?Keyword=<CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>[/url]

Can I get a pointer as to which one I should get?

Much appreciate any help!

Jay

threads.title: Need backlight driver but which one
threads.message: I'd order from here if Louis is out [url]https://microsolderingsupply.com/index.php?route=product/product&path=59_83&product_id=209[/url]

threads.title: Need backlight driver but which one
threads.message:
Thanks for the quick reply John. 
Are none of the options on mouser good/compatible? The source you mention is a dollar more expensive.

threads.title: Need backlight driver but which one
threads.message: I'm sure they are, but I know Jason will for sure give good chips just like Louis. I've never ordered them from Mouser
